title: Bering Land Bridge National Preserve: Villages
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Places to Go     Villages               Villages         Row of houses along the beach. NPS Photo  Deering      Located north of the preserve’s boundary, a 20 mile one-way hike can take you into the preserve.          House on the edge of the barrier island, over looking frozen sea. NPS Photo / Andrea Williams   Shishmaref Located on the barrier island of Sarichef, Shishmaref is known as the "friendliest village in Alaska"            Kids running through town. NPS Photo  Teller Teller can be reached by both commercial airplane and vehicle from Nome, AK.          Grouping of houses in Wales, AK NPS Photo / Phil Westcott  Wales  Wales is North America's most western community on the mainland and one of the oldest Inupiat villages on the Seward Peninsula.
